direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods add elements to the map, but putAll adds a collection of values while put adds a single value.
Both methods modify the map by adding or removing specific values.
Both methods modify the state of the map, either by adding/removing elements or clearing it entirely.
Both methods involve creating or modifying collections within the map.
Both methods handle the addition of multiple elements to the map, but one operates on a single key-collection pair while the other operates on an entire map.

enhanced_by.reason: The collection creation method can be used to set up the initial state for testing putAll.
put can be used to add individual elements before or after putAll to test state transitions.
size can be used to verify the number of elements added by putAll.
containsValue can be used to verify that specific values were added by putAll.
